707617f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 48th St. E.
707617f-a.text:
First Avenue, east side, north from E. 48th Street, showing
prominently the Beekman Towers at Mitchel Place (E. 50th Street).
SilE ouetted against same is a modern apartment house at the S.E.
corner.
July 23, 1939
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

707619f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 48th St.
707619f-a.text:
First Avenue, south from E. 49th Street, showing
a view towards Tudor City and the Wilson packing plant.
In the foreground are two new apartment houses forming
a portion of the locale identified a Beekman Hill.
View 2 is lim'ted to the west side of this thorough-
fare from a point between 49th to 48th Streets.
View 1: June 23, 1930
View 2: Fehruary 9, 1939
P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS

707616f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 48th St.
707616f-a.text:
First Avenue, east side, north from and including 48th Street. The
approach to the Cueensboro Bridge may be seen on the horizon.
The tall apartment house on the S.E. corne of 49th Street was built
early in 1929. The building on the N.E. corner of 49th Street
(Mitchell Place) is the Pan-Hellenic Building, a residence for
sorority girls and sorority clubsg it was built in the spring
and summer of 192B.
July 3, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
